intro: Eriope machrisae, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Eriope machrisae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal climates.
